questions.question: Which technique does CSMA/CA use to avoid collisions?

explanations.a: Correct! CSMA/CA avoids collisions by sensing the channel and using a random backoff before transmission.
explanations.b: Incorrect! CSMA/CA does not detect collisions like CSMA/CD.
explanations.c: Incorrect! Synchronous time slots are used in TDMA, not CSMA/CA.
explanations.d: Incorrect! Token passing is used in token ring networks, not CSMA/CA.

questions.question: Why does CSMA/CA use an acknowledgment (ACK) mechanism?

answers.a: To confirm successful data transmission and avoid retransmission
answers.c: To allow multiple users to transmit at the same time

explanations.a: Correct! CSMA/CA uses ACK to confirm reception and avoid unnecessary retransmissions.
explanations.b: Incorrect! Unlike CSMA/CD, CSMA/CA does not detect collisions but prevents them.
explanations.c: Incorrect! CSMA/CA ensures only one device transmits at a time.
explanations.d: Incorrect! ACK does not increase speed; it ensures reliability.

questions.question: What is the primary reason CSMA/CA is used in wireless networks instead of CSMA/CD?

answers.a: Wireless networks cannot detect collisions efficiently
answers.b: Wireless networks have higher transmission speeds
answers.d: Wireless networks do not experience collisions

explanations.a: Correct! Wireless networks cannot detect collisions effectively, so CSMA/CA avoids them.
explanations.b: Incorrect! Transmission speed is not the reason for choosing CSMA/CA.
explanations.c: Incorrect! Cost is not the primary reason for using CSMA/CA.
explanations.d: Incorrect! Wireless networks do experience collisions but handle them differently.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the RTS/CTS mechanism in CSMA/CA?

answers.a: To reduce the hidden node problem
answers.d: To detect errors in received packets

explanations.a: Correct! RTS/CTS helps in reducing the hidden node problem by reserving the channel.
explanations.b: Incorrect! RTS/CTS does not necessarily increase speed.
explanations.c: Incorrect! It reduces collisions but does not eliminate them entirely.
explanations.d: Incorrect! RTS/CTS is not designed for error detection.

questions.question: What happens when multiple devices sense an idle channel in CSMA/CA?

answers.b: Devices use a random backoff timer before transmitting
answers.c: The first device to transmit gains control of the channel
answers.d: All devices enter a collision state

explanations.a: Incorrect! Simultaneous transmission could cause a collision.
explanations.b: Correct! CSMA/CA introduces a random backoff to reduce collision chances.
explanations.c: Incorrect! There is no guarantee that a single device transmits first.
explanations.d: Incorrect! CSMA/CA prevents collisions rather than detecting them.

questions.question: Why is CSMA/CA preferred in Wi-Fi networks?

answers.a: Because Wi-Fi signals are prone to interference and hidden nodes
answers.c: Because Wi-Fi devices do not need to sense the channel
answers.d: Because CSMA/CA guarantees zero packet loss

explanations.a: Correct! Wi-Fi networks have issues like interference and hidden nodes, making CSMA/CA more suitable.
explanations.b: Incorrect! CSMA/CD is not used in wireless networks due to collision detection limitations.
explanations.c: Incorrect! CSMA/CA requires devices to sense the channel before transmitting.
explanations.d: Incorrect! CSMA/CA reduces packet loss but does not guarantee zero packet loss.
